thread.title: JAL Cargo Announces Fuel Surcharge from August 2015Travelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: JAL Cargo Announces Fuel Surcharge from August 2015Travelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: JAL Cargo Announces Fuel Surcharge from August 2015Travelandtourworld.com
text:
JAL Cargo revises international fuel surcharge from August 2015
Japan Airlines (JAL) has applied to the Japanese Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism (MLIT) to revise its international cargo fuel surcharge for flights departing from Japan from August 1, 2015.
Since April 1, 2009, JAL started adjusting its cargo fuel surcharge levels on a monthly basis by using the one-month average fuel price of Singapore kerosene of the month before last. As the average fuel price of Singapore kerosene for the month of June in 2015 was US$74.63 per barrel, the benchmark fuel price used for calculation of the fuel surcharge level will be within the range of US$70.00 to US$74.99 per barrel (refer to table below).
The international cargo fuel surcharge will therefore be 52 yen per kg on long-haul international routes, 39 yen per kg on medium-haul international routes, and 28 yen on short-haul routes.
Source:- Japan Airlines
